gui.redstone-helper.auto_redstone_desc: Places redstone on every block you placed
gui.redstone-helper.auto_line_desc: Places redstone on every block you placed + places every 15 blocks repeater
gui.redstone-helper.auto_repeater_desc: Places repeaters on every block you placed
gui.redstone-helper.auto_comparator_desc: Places comparators on every block you placed
gui.redstone-helper.cheap_auto_comparato: Places comparators with blocks and redstone like redstone-comparator-block
info.redstone-helper.up_to_date: Redstone Helper is up to date!
info.redstone-helper.need_update: Old version of Redstone Helper detected!
info.redstone-helper.unable_to_check_ver: Unable to check Redstone Helper version!
info.redstone-helper.funny.2: Wtf are you going to use this for?
info.redstone-helper.funny.5: I'm 99% sure you could just use any other thing.
info.redstone-helper.funny.8: Wow, what a fancy but otherwise useless thing.
help.redstone-helper.help:
Here all commands of Redstone Helper:
/redstone-helper <help, version, check-updates [<by-config>]> - mod info
/calc [<"2+2">] - calculates your expression if no expression, it will open calculator
/autowire - opens auto wire menu, you may to be an operator
/autodust - alias for /Auto Wire™
/instaLamp [<state>] - makes lamps to turn off instantly, if "state" argument it will show you current state of instaLamps, you may to be an operator
/redstone-fill <item> <count> - fills Inventory which you are looking with selected item and count, you may to be an operator
/redstone-fill-signal <signal> [<item>] - fills Inventory which you are looking with items to get redstone signal you entered from comparator, if no item it will be fills with wooden shovel, you may to be an operator
/calc-redstone-signal <signal> [<item>] - analog of /redstone-fill-signal for survival, just calculates how much items you need for signal, if no item it will be calc with wooden shovel
/redstone-give <count> [<item>] [<block>] - almost same as /redstone-fill but instead of filling block it gives it to you, you may to be an operator
/redstone-give-signal <signal> [<item>] [<block>] - almost same as /redstone-fill-signal but instead of filling block it gives it to you, you may to be an operator
/ss - alias for /redstone-give-signal
/clear-inventory - clears block inventory which you looking, you may to be an operator
/quicktp [<distance>], [<includeFluids>]
text.config.redstone-helper-config.title: Redstone Helper Settings
